Title: BCH PAT Testing Collaborative Contract
Description:
The Estate Departments for Bedfordshire, Cambridgeshire and Hertfordshire Constabularies (BCH) were seeking the provision for a PAT Testing supplier; to annually service their appliances in all of their sites, with approximately 90000 portable electrical appliances. This is a 3 years BCH Collaborative Agreement, with a possibility to further extend for 12months; at a cost of £50,400.00 per annum. 
A Direct Award through Lot 1 of the ESPO 306 Framework was considered and contract was awarded  to PTSG Electrical Services Ltd. This tender is being awarded to the most economically advantageous supplier. Due diligence has been met; as per the ESPO framework Call Off terms and conditions.

Title: Portable Appliance Testing at various West Midlands Fire Service Stations and Properties
Description:
In accordance with the ESPO Framework Reference: 306 Electrical Testing Service : Lot One : West Midlands Fire and Rescue Authority  (“the Authority”) is conducting this procurement for the purpose of procuring provision of the service described fully in the specification set out in Schedule 2. ( see extract below) 
The Contractor is to carry out Portable Appliance Testing (PAT) to West Midlands Fire service properties in line with the Electricity at Work Regulations 1989. For the purposes of this specification, a portable electrical appliance shall be an item of equipment which is not part of a fixed installation but is, or is intended to be, connected to a fixed installation, or a generator, by means of a flexible cable and a plug and socket. 

The Contractor shall identify each portable electrical appliance with a unique number permanently affixed to the appliance. The individual sockets of multi-socket boards/blocks and extension leads shall be individually identified. The number together with a description of the appliance shall be entered onto report forms which shall be submitted to the Facilities Management Administrator.

Title: The City of Liverpool College - Provision of Electrical Testing - Hard Wiring - AWARD
Description:
The City of Liverpool College are going out to tender for a five (5) year contract for the provision of electrical testing & hard wiring for the College estate.
      
      The documents for this tender are ready to be downloaded and the closing date for the return of your tenders via the College`s In-Tend website is 3.00pm on Friday 3rd May 2019.

Title: KM01.170905 - Portable Appliance Testing at properties owned or managed by Grand Union Housing Group - AWARD
Description:
The Contract requires the Contractor to carry out Portable Appliance Testing to items at Sites owned or managed by the Grand Union Housing Group and it's subsidiaries.
      
      It is intended that the works shall be undertaken to a mixture of different type tenure properties. These will include: General Needs, Retirement Homes, Supported Housing, Supported Living and Registered Care, Offices, etc.
       
      Initially, it is intended that the works will be undertaken at approximately 113 Sites per annum. 
      
      The Contractor will be provided with Orders instructing the works at various stages throughout the duration of the contract.  
      
      It is intended that the Commencement Date shall be 1st January 2018. The Contract Period is 48 months with an option to extend by up to a further 48 months.
      
      The Scope of the Works is fully defined in the Tender Specification.
Contact Address 1: Cranfield University Technology Park, University Way

Title: 306_16 Electrical Testing Services
Description:
The provision of portable appliance testing (PAT), fixed installation testing (FIT), electrical testing of street lights and street furniture.
Lot No: 1 - Portable Appliance Testing (PAT)
Lot No: 2 - Fixed Installation Testing (FIT)
Lot No: 3 - Electrical Testing of Street Lighting and Street Furniture
The framework agreement/contract has the option to extend for up to a further 12 months.  The total estimated value stated includes the option period.
As a Central Purchasing Body as defined by the Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council, the Framework Agreement is open for use by the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authority Councils; Educational Establishments (including Academies); Central Government Departments and Agencies and Local Government Departments and Agencies; Police, Fire and Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services; NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services; Registered Charities; Registered Social Landlords; any Public Body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Full details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas is available on: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal
